required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Image Evaluation for the DREX-KL80 Imaging System
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Image Evaluation for the KALARE (DREX-KL80) With New Digital Camera and Image Processor

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to acquire the clinical data required by the United States Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) for 510(k) submission, for approval of a new high resolution imaging system for fluoroscopy/radiography. It is expected that the new KALARE (DREX-KL80)high resolution imaging system will meet the design specifications. A minimum of 30 cases will be submitted for evaluation of claims for intended clinical applications.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Estimated completion 4 weeks after start of the study
primary_outcome.description: Collect 30 to 60 represenative images to support pre-market submission.

clinical_study.condition: Obtain Diagnostic Images With the New Digital Camera and Image Processor for Evaluation.

arm_group.description: Patient that have been scheduled for routine diagnostic fluoroscopy and angiography procedures by their physician.

intervention.description: KALARE (DREX-KL80) is a new high resolution digital system designed for digital spot imaging, with the primary goal to address R/F and DSA clinical applications and produce images in a digital format. The system includes a new digital camera and a new image processor.

study_pop.textblock: Male and female patient 18 years and older

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female patient 18 years and older
- Not pregnant
- Not a safety risk patient
Exclusion Criteria:
- Male and female patient under 18 years old
- Pregnant subjects
- High safety risk subjects
- Subjects and/or Legal Guardian Unable to provide informed consent
